FuncDef:
The ima ima-group command adds a serial interface to a specified IMA-group interface.
The undo ima ima-group command deletes a serial interface from an IMA-group interface.
By default, no serial interface is added to an IMA-group interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an IMA-group interface.The value is in slot/card/group number format. The slot number and card number must be the same as those of the interface to be added to the IMA group.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To add a serial interface to a specified IMA-group interface, run the ima ima-group command. This configuration improves bandwidth usage flexibility.
Prerequisites
An IMA-group interface has been created. For details, see the interface ima-group command.
Configuration Impact
After a serial interface is added to an IMA-group interface, the configuration of Layer 3 services on the interface does not take effect.
Precautions
Before you change the link layer protocol configured on a serial interface added to an IMA-group interface, run the undo ima ima-group command to delete the interface from the IMA-group interface.
Before you delete the link first added to an IMA-group interface from the group, run the undo interface ima-group command to delete the IMA-group interface.
The ima ima-group command can be run in the view of a serial interface only after the link layer protocol of the interface is configured as ATM.
On the CR5D00C8CF71 subcard, serial interfaces that are created on CPOS interfaces numbered from 0 to 3 can only be bound to IMA-group interfaces numbered from 1 to 256. Serial interfaces that are created on CPOS interfaces numbered from 4 to 7 can only be bound to IMA-group interfaces numbered from 257 to 512.
